title: The sum of money invested at compound interest amounts to Rs 6840 in 2 years and to Rs 8208 in 3 years. What was the amount of the sum invested? - Quora

response.answer_text: 8208 - 6840 = Rs 1368 1368/6840 X100 = 20% Let the amount invested be 100x At 20% , the value after 2 years = 100x+20x + 24x = 144x 144x = 6840 100x = ? 100/144 X 6840 = Rs 4750 ANSWER CHECK 4750*1.2*1.2 = Rs 6840

We know that the amount at end of year 2 is 6840 and at end of year 3 is 8208. This means that if we apply interest at year 2 amount we should get year 3 amount. We can make formula from this: 6840 + (6840 x r) = 8208 r = 0.2 or 20% Now we can use future value formula to find out the principal amount invested i.e. Future value = Amount x (1+ rate) ^ period 8208 = Amount x (1 + 0.2) ^ 3 Amount = 4750

Compound interest AMOUNT Rupees 6840 Year 2 years A =P (1+r/100)^2 6840= p(1+r/100)^2 3 years Rs 8208 Simple interest Interest for in year is = 8208 --6840= 1368 rupees I=PNR /100 1368 = 6840 ×1×R/ 100 R= 1368 ×100/6840 =13680/684= 20% A =P (1+20/100)^2 6840 = P (6/5) (6/5) P=6840×25 /36= 4750 RUPEES The principal amount borrowed is 4750 rupees
